metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18312 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Perl before 5.26.3 and 5.28.0 before 5.28.1 has a buffer overflow via a crafted regular expression that triggers invalid write operations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libperl5.22 - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl-base - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl-debug - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl-modules-5.22 - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: upstream> 5.18 - 5.28 mdeslaur> looks to me like this was introduced by: https://perl5.git.perl.org/perl.git/commit/6798c95dd27b33efd71f394c18649af7bbaf42b7 trusty doesn't look affected

criterions.comment: perl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6').
